trans-unit.target: TEXT_LUCKZJ005_03568_SEQ_00<tab><var 48 F201FC /var><var 49 F201FD /var> Quest Sync<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> The prospective poet is in search of the proper inspiration.
TEXT_LUCKZJ005_03568_TODO_00<tab>Question the residents of the Crystarium.
TEXT_LUCKZJ005_03568_TODO_01<tab>Speak with the prospective poet near the Crystalline Mean.
TEXT_LUCKZJ005_03568_TODO_02<tab>Speak with the prospective poet at the Catenaries.
TEXT_LUCKZJ005_03568_POET03568_000_000<tab>Do you like poetry? This requires a sensitive soul.

TEXT_LUCKZJ005_03568_POET03568_000_001<tab>...Apologies, I probably ought to provide context. I am composing a gift for my aged grandmother, who lost her sight some time ago. I wish to convey to her the endless beauty of the night sky─through verse!

TEXT_LUCKZJ005_03568_POET03568_000_003<tab>To do so, however, I must explore the myriad emotions that that shimmering, inky expanse evokes in the heart─I'm sure you understand. Thus, I would beg you assist me in asking those of the Crystarium what the night sky means to them.

TEXT_LUCKZJ005_03568_RAEQESH_000_010<tab>How does the night sky make me <var 1A 02 /var>feel<var 1A 01 /var>? Fascinated, mainly. It's a far sight different than what I had imagined in reading of it. Brighter and...closer, somehow. As if I could reach out and touch it.

TEXT_LUCKZJ005_03568_VALTHEWYL_000_011<tab>I could scarce believe it, at first, that the night had returned. I stared upward, trying to burn it into my mind, wondering if it would disappear again. And then, I saw a star─I know not how else to describe it─<var 1A 02 /var>fall<var 1A 01 /var>. Astonishing!
TEXT_LUCKZJ005_03568_LEWERALTH_000_012<tab>The night... It is a strange and wonderful thing. Were I to ride my amaro ever upward, I wonder, would I arrive amongst the stars? I think I should like to.
TEXT_LUCKZJ005_03568_RAEQESH_000_013<tab>The books do describe it as “breathtaking,” but...I know now that I never truly understood what that meant. Not until I saw it for myself.
TEXT_LUCKZJ005_03568_VALTHEWYL_000_014<tab>After a time, I began to feel as if I might fall into it, you know. The sky. I wonder─if I did, would I shine as brightly as that star?
TEXT_LUCKZJ005_03568_LEWERALTH_000_015<tab>Perhaps we would simply fly forever, through the dark. I wouldn't mind that, either.
TEXT_LUCKZJ005_03568_POET03568_000_020<tab>And? How did they speak of the night sky to you?
TEXT_LUCKZJ005_03568_POET03568_000_021<tab>Oh, yes... That's <var 1A 02 /var>good<var 1A 01 /var>. I can feel the words stir within me!

TEXT_LUCKZJ005_03568_POET03568_000_022<tab>I must recite this to my grandmother at once, whilst the image remains vivid in my mind. When you have a moment, might you come to the Catenaries and meet her? She's always so delighted by travelers' tales.
TEXT_LUCKZJ005_03568_POET03568_000_030<tab>This is the traveler I told you of, Grandmother. The one who assisted in finding inspiration for my poem!
TEXT_LUCKZJ005_03568_GRANDMOTHER03568_000_031<tab>And what a beautiful poem it was, so full of love and awe and hope.
TEXT_LUCKZJ005_03568_GRANDMOTHER03568_000_032<tab>Just as beautiful as the night sky that you returned to us, my dear, I'm sure.
TEXT_LUCKZJ005_03568_POET03568_000_033<tab>That you─ What!?
TEXT_LUCKZJ005_03568_GRANDMOTHER03568_000_034<tab>You didn't notice, child? You need to truly see the world around you if you are to make a living as a poet...

TEXT_LUCKZJ005_03568_POET03568_000_035<tab>You <var 1A 02 /var>are<var 1A 01 /var> the Warrior of Darkness! And I asked you for help with my poetry... Thank goodness I didn't insist upon reciting it to you─I might have died of shame just now.
TEXT_LUCKZJ005_03568_GRANDMOTHER03568_000_036<tab>Oh, you needn't be so dramatic. It really did turn out quite well─and now we've had this lovely chat. Isn't that right, my dear?
TEXT_LUCKZJ005_03568_GRANDMOTHER03568_000_037<tab>Now, this <var 1A 02 /var>is<var 1A 01 /var> a surprise.
